intro: Perlebia urbaniana, commonly known as the African rain lily, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. The plant typically grows in woodland and grassland habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Perlebia urbaniana is known for its ability to produce numerous small, white flowers that bloom in late summer to early autumn. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in suitable conditions.
